column1: How do I activate my RuPay floater card?
column2:
You can activate your RuPay Floater card with the following steps:

Step 1: Open the OneCard app on your phone.
Step 2: Check the тАШExploreтАЩ section on the home screen and click on тАЬActivate RuPay Card.тАЭ
Step 3: Click on тАЬGet StartedтАЭ and then on тАЬActivate Now."
Step 4: Agree to the terms and conditions and grant the necessary permissions.
ThatтАЩs it! Your RuPay card will be activated.

You can also start your activation process by checking the explore section on the link below. 

https://1cardapp.page.link/open

column2: You will not be able to receive money in your RuPay Credit Card using UPI.\n\nSimilarly, you can only use your Rupay credit card for payments to merchants or bills & recharges. You cannot use it to send money to family members or friends.

column1: Is paying to friend's account available on RuPay Credit Card?
column2: You can only use your Rupay credit card for payments to merchants or bills & recharges. You cannot use it to send money to family members or friends.\n\nSimilarly, you will not be able to receive money in your RuPay Credit Card using UPI.

column1: My OneCard is lost/stolen. What should I do?
column2:
Please take immediate action to lock your card using the app by following these steps:

1. Go to the "My Controls" section in your OneCard app.
2. Click on OneCard Status, and choose "Card is misplaced"
3. Confirm and select 'Yes' to deactivate.


Note: Kindly file a complaint with the cybercrime department for security measures.

column1: What are the Reissuance charges for OneCard
column2:
Plastic Card: First replacement of a plastic OneCard is free, 2nd replacement a fee of Rs 145 + GST and 3rd 500+ GST will be charged.

Metal Card: The card re-issuance fee for metal card is Rs 3000 + GST. 
*Metal card is available only if your FD amount is greater than Rs. 50,000.

column1: What happens if over limit control is disabled on my OneCard?
column2: If the over-limit control is disabled, transactions above the available credit limit will be declined. However, if the account exceeds the limit due to charges or interest, an over-limit fee will be charged.

column1: What if I don't use my OneCard?
column2: Kindly note that your One Credit Card will be closed if not used for more than a year. So, keep transacting and exploring the perks of OneCard!

column1: What is Credit Card on UPI?
column2: You can use your RuPay Credit Card to make UPI payments on OneCard. All you need to do is activate your RuPay Credit Card and UPI and set a UPI PIN to make secure payments.

column1: What is RuPay floater card?
column2: RuPay floater card is a virtual card provided to eligible customers in addition to primary card.\n\nCard can be used for paying online & for paying via UPI on merchants QR

column1: What is the eligibility criteria for a RuPay floater card?
column2: RuPay cards are live for some issuer banks. The launch is being conducted in phases to ensure a seamless experience for all our customers.\n\nRest assured, it will be rolled out for you very soon. When itтАЩs ready, we will send you a notification through the OneCard app.

column1: When will I get credit limit increase on my OneCard?
column2:
Your One Credit Card's limit is based on your credit score, financial history, and our internal policies. Keep using your OneCard responsibly and making timely repayments. 

Once you qualify for an increase, we'll notify you via SMS or email, and you'll find the option to increase your limit in the profile section. 

Keep up your excellent financial habits!

column1: Why is my AWB number not working on delivery partner's website?
column2: Your AWB number activates when your order is dispatched. It stays inactive until then and won't work on third-party websites.\n\nIf your AWB number doesn't work for over 48 hours after the card is dispatched, click below to raise a ticket.

column1: Will my UPI work if I get my RuPay card re-issued or I change my SIM?
column2: In case of a change in RuPay card or SIM, you need to re-register and create a new UPI ID with the new card details.

column1: Can I repay my EMIs using reward points?
column2: Yes! Swipe right on eligible EMI payments in the transactions list to redeem your reward points against your current EMI. Alternatively, you can also redeem rewards against an EMI payment from the reward redemption screen. \n\nEnjoy the perks! ЁЯТ│ЁЯФДЁЯОБ

column1: How many EMIs can I have at a time?
column2:
When you convert transactions within the OneCard app or at a merchant, there's no upper cap on the number of transactions that you can convert. 

Just keep in mind that you can have only one ongoing Balance EMI at a time. 

So, enjoy the flexibility of managing your expenses with ease!

column1: How to avail EMI at the merchant?
column2:
It's easy! Simply head to the Offers tab in your EMI dashboard to find a list of merchants offering EMI. 

When making eligible purchases at the point of sale (POS) machine, you'll see EMI options during checkout. Choose your preferred plan, and it's done!

Your purchase will be converted to EMI within 8 working days.

It's that easy to unlock the flexibility and convenience of EMI with One Credit Card!

column1: How to convert a transaction to emi?
column2: That's easy! All the eligible transactions have a convert option available once you select the transaction. Alternatively, my EMI section in my OneCard page also lists down all the eligible transactions.Click on convert, choose a suitable tenure and confirm to convert to EMI.

column1: How will EMI(s) be charged in my statement?
column2:
The EMI(s) will be a part of the Minimum Amount Due (MAD), which must be paid by the Due Date. 

Note: Non-repayment can lead to the levy of late payment charges, interest and negatively impact your credit score .

Aim to pay the Total Amount Due (TAD) whenever possible for a smoother financial journey!

column1: I am unable to convert an eligible transaction to EMI.
column2: After your transactions are settled, you will have the option to convert eligible ones into EMI. This convenient feature will be accessible through your EMI dashboard.\nAlso, you can reach out to our CX associates and they'll help you in every way possible!

column1: I availed EMI at store but it's not showing in the App.
column2: It can take upto 2-8 working days for EMI availed at the store to reflect in the app.

column1: I got a No Cost EMI offer but I am being charged interest. Why?
column2: With No Cost EMI, the merchant covers the interest, either through an instant discount or cashback equal to the interest which is credited to your One Credit Card account within 90 days of the purchase. \n\nThis means you only pay the product price and nothing extra, making your shopping experience hassle-free and budget-friendly!

column1: I got a refund for my EMI transaction but my EMI is still going. Why isn't it foreclosed?
column2:
Refunds are adjusted in your outstanding amount unless you choose to receive them in your bank account. 

If you're expecting or have received a refund for the EMI transaction, you can choose to foreclose your EMI.
The foreclosure amount will be added to your outstanding amount and will be adjusted with your refund nullifying the transaction. 

Note: The first installment, once posted, cannot be removed.

column1: рдореБрдЭреЗ рдИрдПрдордЖрдИ рдЯреНрд░рд╛рдВрдЬрд╝реЗрдХрд╢рди рдкрд░ рд░рд┐рдлрд╝рдВрдб рдорд┐рд▓ рдЧрдпрд╛ рд╣реИ рд▓реЗрдХрд┐рди рдореЗрд░реА рдИрдПрдордЖрдИ рдЕрднреА рднреА рдЬрд╛ рд░рд╣реА рд╣реИред рдЗрд╕реЗ рдлрд╝реЛрд░рдХреНрд▓реЛреЫ рдХреНрдпреЛрдВ рдирд╣реАрдВ рдХрд┐рдпрд╛ рдЬрд╛рддрд╛?

рд░рд┐рдлрдВрдб рдЖрдкрдХреЗ рдЖрдЙрдЯрд╕реНрдЯреИрдВрдбрд┐рдВрдЧ рдЕрдорд╛рдЙрдВрдЯ рдореЗрдВ рдПрдбрдЬрд╕реНрдЯ рдХрд┐рдП рдЬрд╛рддреЗ рд╣реИрдВ рдЬрдм рддрдХ рдХрд┐ рдЖрдк рдЙрдиреНрд╣реЗрдВ рдЕрдкрдиреЗ рдмреИрдВрдХ рдЦрд╛рддреЗ рдореЗрдВ рд▓реЗрдиреЗ рдХреЗ рд▓рд┐рдП рдирд╣реАрдВ рдХрд╣рддреЗ l

рдпрджрд┐ рдЖрдкрдХреЛ рд░рд┐рдлрд╝рдВрдб рдХреА рдЙрдореНрдореАрдж рд╣реИ, рдпрд╛ рдЖрдкрдХреЛ рдИрдПрдордЖрдИ transaction рдХреЗ рд▓рд┐рдП рд░рд┐рдлрд╝рдВрдб рдорд┐рд▓ рдЪреБрдХрд╛ рд╣реИ, рддреЛ рдЖрдк рдЕрдкрдиреА EMI рдХреЛ рдлреЙрд░рдХреНрд▓реЛрдЬрд╝ рдХрд░ рд╕рдХрддреЗ рд╣реИрдВред

рдпрд╣ рдЖрдкрдХреЗ рдЖрдЙрдЯрд╕реНрдЯреИрдВрдбрд┐рдВрдЧ рдЕрдорд╛рдЙрдВрдЯ рдореЗрдВ рдЬреЛрдбрд╝рд╛ рдЬрд╛рдПрдЧрд╛ рдФрд░ рд░рд┐рдлрдВрдб рдХреЗ рд╕рд╛рде рдПрдбрдЬрд╕реНрдЯ рдХрд┐рдпрд╛ рдЬрд╛рдПрдЧрд╛ред

column1: I got refund for transaction which is converted to EMI.
column2: Refunds are considered as instant credits to your One Credit Card balance. You have the flexibily to continue your EMI or you can foreclose it by paying foreclosure fees.

column1: I had a cashback offer but I have not received it yet. Why?
column2: When you use cashback offers, One Credit Card collects the cashback from the merchant and sends it to you!\n\nThis process typically takes 60-90 days. If you haven't received your cashback after 90 days, feel free to contact our Customer Experience team for assistance!

column1: I want to convert my bill to EMI
column2:
One Credit Card offers an EMI on bill feature to our eligible customers, depending on our internal policies like ongoing EMIs, minimum amount due, etc. 

Other conditions would be:

1. Outstanding amount should be atleast Rs.2500 or more.

2. Bill needs to generated.

3. There should not be any existing balance EMI.

Visit EMI Dashboard to check your eligibility for the same.

column1: What fees and charges are applicable on converting a purchase to EMI?
column2:
When converting any purchase into EMI, processing fees, interest fees, and foreclosure fees(only in case of EMI foreclosure) are applicable.

The processing fee is 1% of the transaction amount or minimum тВ╣99, whichever is higher, plus applicable GST.

EMI interest rates range between 12-24%, depending on factors such as your credit usage, our risk policy, and many other factors.

The foreclosure fee which is only charged in the case of EMI foreclosure is 3% of the remaining principal amount or minimum тВ╣99, plus applicable GST.

column1: рдПрдХ рдЦрд░реАрдж рдХреЛ рдИрдПрдордЖрдИ рдореЗрдВ рдмрджрд▓рдиреЗ рдкрд░ рдХрд┐рддрдиреА рдлрд╝реАрд╕ рдФрд░ рдЪрд╛рд░реНрдЬреЗрд╕ рд▓рд╛рдЧреВ рд╣реЛрддреЗ рд╣реИрдВ?

рдЖрдкрдХреЗ рдХреНрд░реЗрдбрд┐рдЯ рдЙрдкрдпреЛрдЧ, рд╣рдорд╛рд░реА рд░рд┐рд╕реНрдХ рдкреЙрд▓рд┐рд╕реА рдФрд░ рдХрдИ рдЕрдиреНрдп рдЪреАрдЬрд╝реЛ рдХреА рд╡рдЬрд╣ рд╕реЗ рдИрдПрдордЖрдИ рдЗрдВрдЯрд░реЗрд╕реНрдЯ рд░реЗрдЯ 12-24% рдХреЗ рдмреАрдЪ рд╣реЛрддреА рд╣реИред

рдлрд╝реЛрд░рдХреНрд▓реЛрдЬрд╝рд░ рдлрд╝реАрд╕ рдмрдЪреА рд╣реБрдИ рдкреНрд░рд┐рдВрд╕рд┐рдкрд▓ рдЕрдорд╛рдЙрдВрдЯ рдХрд╛ 3% рдпрд╛ рд░реБ. 99, рдЬреЛ рднреА реЫреНрдпрд╛рджрд╛ рд╣реЛ, + рд▓рд╛рдЧреВ рдЬреАрдПрд╕рдЯреА рд╣реЛрддрд╛ рд╣реИред

column1: What if I miss my EMI payment?
column2: EMI payments are part of the monthly Minimum Amount Due (MAD). Missing the EMI payment for 60 days leads to automatic foreclosure, and missing for 90 days may result in OneCard blocking. Additionally, your credit score will be negatively impacted. ЁЯТ│тП░\n\nKeep your financial journey smooth and your credit score positive by making your monthly payments regularly! ЁЯШКЁЯТ│

column1: What is EMI foreclosure? How to initiate the same?
column2:
Foreclosure means making a single payment to repay the entire outstanding amount before completion of the EMI tenure.

To initiate EMI foreclosure, click on the link below:

https://1cardapp.page.link/edb

column1: Why are all my Installments not equal?
column2: One Credit Card EMI operates on a reducing balance method, which means that each month, you repay a portion of the principal amount along with the interest on the remaining outstanding balance. As a result, the EMI amount decreases over time.\n\nAdditionally, the GST is applicable to the fees and charges associated with the EMI. The GST rate is subject to government regulations and can impact the overall cost of the EMI.

column1: рдореЗрд░реА рд╕рднреА рдХрд┐рд╢реНрддреЗрдВ рдмрд░рд╛рдмрд░ рдХреНрдпреЛрдВ рдирд╣реАрдВ рд╣реИрдВ?
column2:
OneCard рдИрдПрдордЖрдИ рд░рд┐рдбреНрдпреВрд╕рд┐рдВрдЧ рдмреИрд▓реЗрдВрд╕ рдореЗрдердб рдкрд░ рдХрд╛рдо рдХрд░рддрд╛ рд╣реИред 

рдЗрд╕рд▓рд┐рдП рдкреНрд░рддреНрдпреЗрдХ рдорд╣реАрдиреЗ, рдЖрдк рдПрдХ рдЕрд▓рдЧ рдЗрдВрдЯрд░реЗрд╕реНрдЯ рдФрд░ рдкреНрд░рд┐рдВрд╕рд┐рдкрд▓ рдЕрдорд╛рдЙрдВрдЯ рдЪреБрдХрд╛рддреЗ рд╣реИрдВ рдмрдЪреЗ рд╣реБрдП рдЖрдЙрдЯрд╕реНрдЯреИрдВрдбрд┐рдВрдЧ рдмреИрд▓реЗрдВрд╕ рдкрд░ред 

рд▓реЗрдХрд┐рди рд╕рд░рдХрд╛рд░ рджреНрд╡рд╛рд░рд╛ рдЬреАрдПрд╕рдЯреА рд▓рдЧрд╛рдпрд╛ рдЬрд╛рддрд╛ рд╣реИ, рдЬреЛ рдЗрдВрдЯрд░реЗрд╕реНрдЯ рдХреЗ рдЖрдзрд╛рд░ рдкрд░ рдмрджрд▓рддрд╛ рд╣реИ, рдЬрд┐рд╕рд╕реЗ рдЖрдкрдХреА рдИрдПрдордЖрдИ рдХреА рд░рд╛рд╢рд┐ рдмрджрд▓ рдЬрд╛рддреА рд╣реИред

column1: Why can't I see any transactions in the EMI dashboard?
column2:
Only the eligible transactions are visible in the EMI dashboard. 

Disputed, not settled, billed or already converted transactions and non-purchase transactions like repayments, refunds, rewards are not eligible for EMI.

Other possible reasons include:

1. Transaction amount is less than the minimum eligible amount i.e. Rs.2500 or greater than the Total Outstanding Balance.

2. Transaction is not from the present bill cycle.

3. Transaction belongs to unsupported merchant categories that includes Jewellery, Fuel, Rent & Transfers.

column1: рдореБрдЭреЗ рдИрдПрдордЖрдИ рдбреИрд╢рдмреЛрд░реНрдб рдкрд░ рдХреЛрдИ рдЯреНрд░рд╛рдВрдЬрд╝реЗрдХрд╢рдиреНрд╕ рджрд┐рдЦрд╛рдИ рдХреНрдпреЛрдВ рдирд╣реАрдВ рджреЗ рд░рд╣реА рд╣реИ?
column2:
рдПрд▓рд┐рдЬрд┐рдмрд┐рд▓ transaction рдХреЗрд╡рд▓ рдИрдПрдордЖрдИ рдбреИрд╢рдмреЛрд░реНрдб рдореЗрдВ рджрд┐рдЦрд╛рдИ рдЬрд╛рддреА рд╣реИред

рдбрд┐рд╕реНрдкреНрдпреВрдЯ, рд╕реЗрдЯрд▓ рдирд╣реАрдВ рд╣реБрдпреЗ, рдмрд┐рд▓ рдХрд┐рдпрд╛ рдЧрдпрд╛ рдпрд╛ рдкрд╣рд▓реЗ рд╕реЗ рд╣реА рдХрдиреНрд╡рд░реНрдЯ рдХрд┐рдП рдЧрдП transactions рдФрд░ рдЕрдиреНрдп transactions рдЬреИрд╕реЗ рд░реАрдкреЗрдореЗрдВрдЯ, рд░рд┐рдлрдВрдб рдФрд░ рд░рд┐рд╡рд╛рд░реНрдбреНрд╕ рдИрдордЖрдИ рдХреЗ рд▓рд┐рдП рдпреЛрдЧреНрдп рдирд╣реАрдВ рд╣реИрдВред

рдЕрдиреНрдп рд╕рдВрднрд╛рд╡рд┐рдд рдХрд╛рд░рдгреЛрдВ рдореЗрдВ рд╢рд╛рдорд┐рд▓ рд╣реИрдВ:

1.Transaction рдХреА amount рдорд┐рдирд┐рдордо рдПрд▓рд┐рдЬрд┐рдмрд┐рд▓ amount, рдЕрд░реНрдерд╛рдд Rs.2500 рд╕реЗ рдХрдо рд╣реИ рдпрд╛ рдЯреЛрдЯрд▓ рдЖрдЙрдЯрд╕реНрдЯреИрдВрдбрд┐рдВрдЧ amount рд╕реЗ реЫреНрдпрд╛рджрд╛ рд╣реИред

2.Transaction рд╡рд░реНрддрдорд╛рди рдмрд┐рд▓ рд╕рд╛рдЗрдХрд┐рд▓ рдореЗрдВ рдирд╣реАрдВ рд╣реИред

3.Transaction рдЕрдирд╕рдкреЛрд░реНрдЯреЗрдб рдорд░реНрдЪреЗрдВрдЯ рдХреИрдЯреЗрдЧрд░реА рдореЗрдВ рд╣реИ рдЬрд┐рд╕рдореЗрдВ рдЬреНрд╡реЗрд▓рд░реА, рдлреНрдпреВрд▓, рдХрд┐рд░рд╛рдпрд╛/ рд░реЗрдВрдЯ рдФрд░ рдЯреНрд░рд╛рдВрд╕рдлрд░ рд╢рд╛рдорд┐рд▓ рд╣реИред

column1: Why is my 1st EMI installment higher than others?
column2: Your first EMI is higher than other installments as it includes a one time processing fee in addition to the regular principle amount, interest and GST charges. \n\nThis upfront payment ensures a smooth start to your repayment journey, with subsequent EMIs becoming more manageable over time.

column1: рдореЗрд░реА рдИрдПрдордЖрдИ рдХреА рдкрд╣рд▓реА рдХрд┐рд╢реНрдд рджреВрд╕рд░реЛрдВ рдХреА рддреБрд▓рдирд╛ рдореЗрдВ рдЕрдзрд┐рдХ рдХреНрдпреЛрдВ рд╣реИ?
column2: рдЖрдкрдХреА рдкрд╣рд▓реА EMI рдЕрдиреНрдп рдХрд┐рд╕реНрддреЛрдВ рд╕реЗ рдЬрд╝реНрдпрд╛рджрд╛ рд╣реЛрддреА рд╣реИ рдХреНрдпреЛрдВрдХрд┐ рдЗрд╕рдореЗрдВ рдкреНрд░рд┐рдВрд╕рд┐рдкрд▓ рдЕрдорд╛рдЙрдВрдЯ, рдмреНрдпрд╛рдЬ рдФрд░ GST рд╢реБрд▓реНрдХ рдХреЗ рдЕрд▓рд╛рд╡рд╛ рдПрдХ рдмрд╛рд░ рдХреА рдкреНрд░реЛрд╕реЗрд╕рд┐рдВрдЧ рдлреАрд╕ рднреА рд╢рд╛рдорд┐рд▓ рд╣реЛрддреА рд╣реИред

column1: Why is the EMI amount shown and charged different?
column2:
The EMI amount consists of an interest and principal component. 

kindly note that the charged amount also includes GST that is levied on fees and charges and is subject to change as per the Government Rules and Regulations. 

Currently the applicable GST is 18%.

column2: You can set monthly spending limits ranging from Rs. 2000 to your entire limit for each family member. These limits will reset on the first of every month, ensuring a fresh start and better control over expenses.

column1: How to close my fixed deposit?
column2: You can close your FD by closing your OneCard. Your OneCard will be closed once you have cleared the outstanding balance. Within 7-10 day of closure, your fixed deposit amount will be refunded to the bank account you submit while creating the fixed deposit. Early card closure charges will be applied if card is closed within 6 months. A penalty of 1% will be levied on the interest earned for closing the fixed deposit before tenure period.\n\nNOTE: Currently we do not allow creation of OneCard once closed.

- Go to 'Profile'.
- Scroll down and select 'Add Bank Details'.

column2: Yes, there will be offers on Mobile Recharges. However, they may vary depending on your credit card usage.\n

column1: Why can't I fetch my electricity bill?
column2: You may not be able to fetch your electricity bill on OneCard if your electricity provider has not yet uploaded the bill online. Please wait for a few days and try again.\n\nIf you need further assistance, please contact your electricity provider.

column1: Why am I unable to find my electricity provider?
column2: Your electricity provider may not be listed on OneCard yet.\n\nWeтАЩre constantly updating the available electricity providers. Please check the app regularly.

column1: What if I paid someone else's electricity bill by mistake?
column2: You cannot cancel an electricity bill payment once the payment is successful. If you have paid a bill incorrectly, we request you to contact your electricity provider for assistance.

column1: Can I cancel my paid electricity bill?
column2: No, you cannot cancel your bill payment once the payment is made successfully. If your bill payment fails for any reason, the entire payment amount will be refunded to you.

column1: Why is my bill payment not reflecting even after successful payment?
column2: Your electricity provider will take 3 to 4 days to update your successful bill payment on their portal. You can check the final status on the portal after 3 or 4 days.\n\nPlease always pay your electricity bill on or before the due date. In this case, you will not be charged any late fees even if your electricity provider takes time to complete the bill payment.

column1: Why is my bill payment pending?
column2:
Bill payments on OneCard are usually instant. However, in rare cases, they may take longer than usual to be completed. If you see your bill payment pending on OneCard, it means that weтАЩre waiting for a confirmation from your electricity provider.

Please wait for a few hours and check the тАШPayment HistoryтАЩ section of your app to know the final status of your payment.

If your pending electricity bill payment fails, your payment amount will be refunded to you.

column1: When will money be refunded for a failed bill payment?
column2: If your electricity bill payment fails, your payment amount will be refunded within 5-7 working days.

column1: What if I have paid my electricity bill twice?
column2: There is no need to worry if you pay your bill two times, as the electricity provider will adjust the extra amount in the next billing cycle.

column1: How do I get an invoice for my electricity bill payment?
column2: The invoice for your bill payment transaction can be downloaded from the тАШOrder HistoryтАЩ section.

column1: How can I pay my water bill through OneCard?
column2:
Open the OneCard app.
Go to тАШBill PaymentsтАЩ in OneStore.
Click on 'Water.тАЩ
Select your water supply board.
Select your service type (if any)
Enter the тАШcustomer identification numberтАЩ (such as Consumer Number, Connection Number, K Number etc.)
Click on тАШProceedтАЩ to check the water bill amount
Review your details and complete the payment.

column1: What happens if the customer has made the payment using OneCard, and the amount has been deducted, but they have not received any message from their service provider stating that the recharge is successful?
column2: Whether the recharge fails or is successful, the user will get a push notification from OneCard regarding the recharge status. If the recharge fails, the money will be refunded within 7 working days.

column1: What is a Customer Identification Number?
column2:
A customer identification number, as the name suggests, is a unique identification number provided to every user. This is how the water boards differentiate one user from another. The name for the customer identification number can be different for every board.

Here are a few examples-

RR Number for BWSSB
Customer ID for CIDCO, DDA
K Number for DJB
Consumer Number for Department of Public Health Engineering Mizoram
Connection ID for GWMC and so on
You can find your customer identification number on any of your water bills, latest or previous.

column1: How do I pay my LIC or insurance premium on OneCard?
column2:
To pay your insurance premium:
- Navigate to тАШBill PaymentsтАЩ under OneStore in the OneCard app
- Select тАШInsuranceтАЩ
- Search for your insurance provider or select your insurance provider and enter the policy number and other required details.
- Tap тАШConfirmтАЩ and complete the payment.

column1: Where do I find my insurance policy number?
column2: You can find your policy number in your policy document, or in the official communications sent to you by the insurance provider.

column1: How do I get the invoice/receipt for my insurance premium payment?
column2:
You can download the receipt for your LIC insurance premium payment directly from OneCard app. 
Go to the тАШOrder HistoryтАЩ section in OneStore.
Select the relevant insurance premium payment.
Tap тАШDownload ReceiptтАЩ.

column1: How do I find the transaction reference ID?
column2: To find the transaction reference ID for your payment: \nGo to OneStore in the OneCard app.\nTap тАШOrder HistoryтАЩ and select the relevant payment.

column1: Why is my insurance premium payment pending?
column2: Insurance premium payments on OneCard are usually instant, but in rare cases, they may take longer than usual to be completed. This means that weтАЩre waiting for a confirmation from your insurance provider. In such cases, please wait for a few hours and check the History section on your OneCard app for the final status of your payment.

column1: What if my LIC premium payment fails?
column2: In case your payment fails, the money will be refunded to you in 5-7 working days.

column1: Why is my premium payment still showing as due on the insurer's platform?
column2: Insurance providers usually take about 3 to 4 days to complete the premium payment. You can check the status after 3 to 4 days from the date of payment on the insurerтАЩs platform for a confirmation.

column1: Which insurers are supported?
column2: For the latest updated list of insurers available, please visit the тАШInsuranceтАЩ category under the тАШBill PaymentsтАЩ section.

column1: Can an insurance premium payment be cancelled for a refund?
column2: No, the insurance premium paid by you through OneCard cannot be cancelled, and therefore no refund can be issued.\n

column1: Is there a limit on the number of transactions or transaction amount for mobile recharge?
column2: No, there is no limit on the number of transactions or transaction amount for mobile recharge.\n

column1: Why am I unable to make an insurance premium payment?
column2: Please ensure that you select the right insurer and enter all required details while paying the insurance premium through OneCard app. Also, ensure that you are making the payments before the last date for payment of the insurance premium or within the grace period.

column1: How do I pay municipal tax on OneCard?
column2:
You can pay Municipal Tax towards any of the Municipal Corporations/Councils listed on OneCard.

To pay municipal tax:
Go to the тАШBill PaymentsтАЩ section in OneStore.
Tap on тАШMunicipal TaxтАЩ.
Search for the Municipal Corporation/Council that you need to make a payment toward.
Select the Municipal Corporation/Council and enter the relevant details.
Tap тАШConfirmтАЩ and complete the payment.

column1: Why is my municipal tax payment pending?
column2: Municipal tax payments on OneCard are usually instant, but in rare cases, they may take longer than usual to be completed. This means that we are waiting for a confirmation from the municipal corporation/council. In such cases, please wait for a few hours and check the Order History section on your OneCard app for the final status of the payment.\n\nIn case the pending bill payment fails, the debited money will be refunded to you based on the mode of payment you used.

column1: Why is my municipal tax payment not reflecting even after successful payment?
column2: Most municipal corporations take about 3 to 4 days to complete the tax payment and reflect it on their portals. You can check the status after 3 to 4 days from the date of payment.

column1: How do I get the invoice for my municipal tax payment?
column2: You will receive a payment receipt for all municipal tax payments you make through OneCard.

column1: How can I pay my Hospital Bills?
column2:
Log in to the OneCard app
Navigate to OneStore
Tap on тАШBill PaymentsтАЩ
Select тАШHospitalsтАЩ
Enter your UHID, consumer number, and registered mobile number, and click on тАШProceedтАЩ
Verify that your mobile number is correct before clicking on тАШContinueтАЩ
Enter the 6-digit OTP received on your mobile number and click on тАШVerify and ContinueтАЩ
Review your hospital bill details, and click on тАШPayтАЩ

column1: Can I pay my hospital bill in instalments?
column2: This depends on the respective hospitalтАЩs payment policies. Before you plan your bill instalment contact their billing department for more information.

column1: Are there any discounts or financial assistance options for hospital bill payments at the hospital?
column2: Hospitals may offer discounts or financial assistance programs to eligible individuals. Inquire with their billing department to explore available options.

column1: How can I request a detailed breakdown of charges on my hospital bill?
column2: To request a detailed breakdown of charges on your Hospital bill, simply contact the hospital's billing department, and they will provide you with the information you need.

column1: What is the deadline for paying my hospital bill?
column2: The payment deadline for your Hospital bill may vary, so it's essential to check the due date specified on your bill and ensure timely payment.

column1: What if the amount is not refunded back within the given turn around time (TAT)?
column2: If the amount is not refunded within the specified TAT, it needs to be raised with the Customer Support team.\n

column1: What are the benefits of paying hospital bills through OneCard?
column2:
Paying your hospital bills through OneCard offers numerous advantages such as:
Convenience: User-friendly online payment platform allows you to settle your bills from the comfort of your homes. No more waiting in long queues or dealing with paperwork.
Accessibility: Make payments 24/7, ensuring you never miss a due date.
Secure transactions: Encryption and safety measures that guarantee a secure payment process.
Efficient customer support: Readily available customer care team to assist and ensure a smooth payment experience.

column1: How do I pay my club or association membership fee on OneCard App?
column2:
Log in to the OneCard App
Go to the тАШBill Payments' section in OneStore tab
Select тАШClubs and AssociationsтАЩ and enter your membership details
Verify payment information and complete the transaction.

column1: How do I get a payment receipt for my club or association membership fee payment?
column2: Users can click the тАШDownload ReceiptтАЩ button after completing the club or association membership fee payment under the тАШOrder HistoryтАЩ section by selecting the relevant payment details.

column1: What payments can I make towards clubs and associations on OneCard?
column2: Currently, you can only pay your club and association membership fee.

column1: What if I am unable to find my club or association listed on OneCard?
column2: If you donтАЩt find a specific club or association, we might not have registered them for this service on OneCard yet. Check back on the app regularly, as weтАЩre always adding new clubs and associations.

column1: What if my club or association membership fee payment is pending?
column2: Membership fee payments to clubs or associations on OneCard are usually instant. In rare cases, due to technical issues, it may take longer than usual to receive a payment confirmation from the bank. In such cases, please check the тАШOrder HistoryтАЩ section of your OneCard app after a few hours for the final payment status.

column1: Why is my club or association membership fee payment not reflecting even after it is successful?
column2: Some banks may take up to 3 to 4 days to update your successful club or association membership fee payment in their records. You can check the status after 3 to 4 days from the date of payment for a confirmation.

column1: How do I pay Education fees?
column2:
1. Go to the тАЬBill PaymentsтАЭ section in OneStore.
2. Tap тАШEducation FeesтАЩ.
3. Choose from the list of institutes after selecting the state and city of the institute.
4.Enter the required details and continue to pay.

column1: How much time will it take for a payment to be accepted by the institute?
column2: Payments are usually reflected within 24-48 hours, depending on the institute's processing time.

column1: Can I cancel a fee payment for a refund?
column2: You should check with the respective institution's refund policy.

column1: How do I recharge my prepaid mobile number?
column2:
To recharge your prepaid mobile number, follow these steps:
Open the OneCard app.
Navigate to the Store tab.
Select "Mobile Recharges."
Enter your prepaid mobile number.
Choose a plan from the provided list.
Review the payment details.
Complete the payment by selecting "Swipe-to-Pay."
Check for the success, failed, or pending screen.
For a direct link to the mobile recharge page, use: OneCard Mobile Recharge

column1: Why am I unable to complete my education fee payment?
column2: Technical issues or incorrect details can hinder payment.

column1: Why is my school, college, or university not listed on OneCard App?
column2: One Card App constantly updates its list. If your institution is not listed, visit the тАШBill PaymentsтАЩ section after a few days.

column1: Why did my education fee payment fail?
column2: Possible reasons could be a server issue, incorrect payment details, or insufficient funds.

column1: What are the donations that I can make on OneCard app?
column2:
You can donate money to NGOs. These are non-profit organizations, registered as per the law, that work toward the betterment of society.
You can donate to a cause. A cause is a campaign launched by NGOs to collect money for a specific cause.
The money you donate to a cause will only be used for the particular campaign.
You can also donate to a religious institution that is listed on OneCard.

column1: How do I make a donation on OneCard app?
column2:
To make a donation to a cause, an NGO, or a religious institution listed on OneCard,

Go to the тАШBill PaymentsтАЩ section in OneStore.
Tap on тАШDonationsтАЩ
Select an NGO, a cause, or a religious institution.
Enter your details.
For donations, please provide the name and email ID that you would like to be shown on the donation receipt.
Enter or select the amount and tap тАШDonateтАЩ to make the payment.
If you donate to an NGO, you will get a donation receipt within 45 days, on the email ID you provided. However, you will not receive a donation receipt for your donation to any religious institutions.

column1: Can I cancel a donation that I made on OneCard app?
column2: No, you will not be able to cancel a donation made on OneCard.

column1: What if my donation receipt shows incorrect details?
column2: Your donation receipt will have the same details that you provided while making your donation. If any details, such as your name, email ID, amount, or date, are incorrect, please contact the NGO directly for assistance within 45 days from the date of donation.

column1: Can I make multiple donations?
column2:
Yes, you can make multiple donations to:

Different NGOs, causes, or religious institutions listed on OneCard App from the same account
The same NGO, cause, or religious institution from the same account
The same NGO, cause, or religious institution from different accounts
Note: When making donations from the same account, the payment amount will depend on the payment limit set by your bank.

column1: Do I need to submit any documents to make a donation?
column2: For any donation exceeding тВ╣50,000 in one year, through single or multiple donations, you will need to submit your PAN card details, to the NGO youтАЩve donated to or the religious institution. They will contact you on the email ID you provided while making the donation.

column1: Can I make an anonymous donation?
column2:
No, you will not be able to make an anonymous donation. As per the law, it is mandatory to provide a name while making a donation.


For donations to NGOs, please provide the name and email ID that you would like to be shown on the donation receipt.

column1: How should I delete/remove other saved contact details?
column2: As of now, the functionality to delete or remove saved contact details is not available. We apologize for any inconvenience.\n

column1: рдЕрдиреНрдп рд╕рд╣реЗрдЬреЗ рдЧрдП рд╕рдВрдкрд░реНрдХ рд╡рд┐рд╡рд░рдгреЛрдВ рдХреЛ рдХреИрд╕реЗ рд╣рдЯрд╛рдпрд╛ рдЬрд╛рдП?
column2: рдЕрднреА рддрдХ, рд╕рд╣реЗрдЬреЗ рдЧрдП рд╕рдВрдкрд░реНрдХ рд╡рд┐рд╡рд░рдгреЛрдВ рдХреЛ рд╣рдЯрд╛рдиреЗ рдпрд╛ рдирд┐рдХрд╛рд▓рдиреЗ рдХреА рдХреНрд╖рдорддрд╛ рдЙрдкрд▓рдмреНрдз рдирд╣реАрдВ рд╣реИред рд╣рдо рдХрд┐рд╕реА рднреА рдЕрд╕реБрд╡рд┐рдзрд╛ рдХреЗ рд▓рд┐рдП рдЦреЗрдж рдкреНрд░рдХрдЯ рдХрд░рддреЗ рд╣реИрдВред

column1: What is a donation receipt?
column2: A donation receipt is a confirmation you get when you donate money to any organisation. If you donate to any of the listed NGOs on OneCard, they will send you a donation receipt through the email ID you provided while making a donation.\n\nImportant: You will get a donation receipt within 45 days from the NGO you donated to. However, you will not receive a donation receipt for your donation to any religious institutions.

column1: How do I claim tax exemption for my donation(s)?
column2: To claim tax exemption for your donation, you need a certificate called a 10BE certificate. This certificate is given by the NGO you donated to, and is used to inform the Income Tax authorities about your donation.\n\nTo receive the 10BE certificate, share your address, PAN, and other details over the email sent to you by the NGO you donated to.

column1: What is FASTag?
column2: FASTags are prepaid rechargeable tags that you can use to make automatic payments at toll booths. With a FASTag, you can drive through all toll booths without having to stop. FASTags are usually stuck on the windshield of your vehicle. As soon as your vehicle crosses a toll booth, the toll fee will be deducted from the bank account or prepaid wallet that you have linked to your FASTag.

column1: What are the benefits of using a FASTag?
column2:
Ease of making payments: You can save time as you donтАЩt need to carry cash for toll payments.
Online recharge: You can recharge your FASTag online by using any of the available payment modes.
Instant notifications: You will receive SMS alerts for toll payments, low balance, and so on.
Easy management: Access to an online portal for easy tag management.

column1: Till what time is my FASTag wallet valid?
column2: Your FASTag is valid for five years from the date of issue. When the tag expires, it will be automatically renewed for another five years, and you will be notified.

column1: How do I locate the issuer bank of my FASTag?
column2: The name of the bank that issued your FASTag will be displayed on the left side corner of the blue strip on your FASTag.

column1: What if I see a тАШvehicle details not found' error?
column2:
You may see this error due to one of the below reasons:

Your FASTag wallet is not yet activated by your bank.
You have selected the wrong FASTag issuer bank.
Usually, new vehicles are generally registered with a chassis number instead of the vehicle registration number. Try entering your vehicleтАЩs chassis number in the Vehicle Number field.

column1: What is the validity of a FASTag?
column2: A FASTag is valid for 5 years from the date of purchase. You can recharge or top-up the FASTag as per your requirement during this validity period.

column1: Can I cancel a FASTag recharge I have made on OneCard?
column2: No, you canтАЩt cancel a FASTag recharge youтАЩve made on OneCard once youтАЩve made the payment.

column1: Are there any FASTag recharge limits on OneCard?
column2: There may be limits on the recharge amount per payment and limits on the number of times you can recharge your FASTag in one day and in one month. These limits vary from bank to bank.

column1: Which network service providers are supported for Mobile Prepaid Recharges via the OneCard app?
column2:
As of now, you will be able to recharge mobile numbers only from the below listed network service providers:
Jio
Airtel
Vi (Vodafone Idea)
Other network service providers will be made available soon.

column1: What if my FASTag recharge payment is pending on OneCard?
column2: FASTag recharges on OneCard are usually instant. However, in rare cases, due to technical issues, your FASTag issuing bank may take longer than usual to confirm the status of your payment. We request you to check the History section of your OneCard app after a few hours from the time of recharge to know the final recharge status.\n\nIf your FASTag recharge fails for any reason, the entire amount will be refunded to you within 5 to 7 working days.

column1: What if my FASTag balance is not updated after a successful payment?
column2:
While most FASTag recharges are updated instantly after a successful payment, sometimes there can be a delay in updating the status of the recharge from the FASTag issuing bankтАЩs end.

If your FASTag balance is yet to be updated, please wait for 2 working days.

If your FASTag balance is still not updated after 2 working days, please contact your FASTag issuing bank and share the Operator Reference ID with them. You can find the Operator Reference ID in the History section of your OneCard app.

column1: I've recharged my FASTag account, but I'm unable to cross the toll.
column2: Once the amount is added to your FASTag account, it may take up to 15 to 30 minutes to reflect in Toll Plaza servers as they are updated every 15 to 30 minutes.\nIf you're unable to cross the toll even after 30 minutes and have a minimum balance in your FASTag account as per your vehicle, contact your FASTag issuing bank for assistance.

column1: What documents do I need to provide for online FASTag recharge?
column2: Recharging your FASTag account online typically does not require any physical documentation. However, when you register for the first time, you might need your RC and KYC documents like an Aadhaar card, passport, voter's ID, or PAN card.

column1: Is there a customer support number for assistance with online FASTag recharge?
column2: Yes, most FASTag issuers provide a customer support number for assistance with online FASTag recharges. Check their official website for relevant contact information.

column1: Can I pay my gas bill through the app?
column2: Yes, you can conveniently pay your gas bill online through the OneCard app.

column1: What information do I need to provide when making a gas bill payment on an app?
column2: You will need your consumer number and the bill amount when making a gas bill payment through an app.

column1: How to check my gas pipeline bill payment status?
column2: Log in to the OneCard App, Go to тАШOrder HistoryтАЩ, select the specific тАШGas BillтАЩ payment, and view the status.

column1: IтАЩm unable to recharge my BSNL or MTNL mobile number?
column2:
As of now, you will be able to recharge mobile numbers only from the below listed network service providers:
Jio
Airtel
Vi (Vodafone Idea)
Other network service providers will be made available soon.

column1: Why is my mobile recharge payment status showing as pending?
column2: -First, go check check if your services have been resumed by the network provider or not. Sometimes, just the status is not updated to successful but the services have been resumed.\n-This is a very rare scenario and it is because recharges generally take 10 seconds to 20 minutes for completion.\n-In case your recharge is pending, please wait till 24hrs for a confirmation. If the status moves to тАШSuccessfulтАЩ the plan selected will be applied to your mobile number. If the status changes to failed, the amount paid will be refunded to the original payment source.

column1: The app shows recharge is successful, but the benefit is not received.
column2:
Please verify the number used for recharge, and check SMS for a Success/ Failure message from the operator. Also, verify your prepaid mobile account, some plans are activated only after the expiry of the current plan.
After verifying the above details, please check if the recharge is reflecting on your operator app and take a screenshot, through the following steps:
Jio тАУ
1. Open the My Jio app
2. On the home page, go to тАЬMy Accounts section to check the status of your current recharge.
Airtel тАУ
1. Open the Airtel Thanks app
2. Click on the services section on the homepage to check the status of the recharge for your prepaid number
Vi тАУ
1. Open the Vi app
2. On the homepage, click on the тАЬpack detailsтАЭ option, which is underneath the data and talk time
information, to check the status of your current recharge.
If the recharged plan is not reflecting on the operator app, you can also check directly with your operator as detailed in the section. YouтАЩve contacted the operator and theyтАЩve denied having received the recharge amount,
Then please write to us by sharing proof of communication (email, support chat message, or SMS)
within 5 days of the transaction.

column1: Why is my recharge failing repeatedly?
column2: - If your recharge is failing repeatedly, check if you have selected a valid recharge amount for your operator. If your recharge fails even if your amount and other details are correct, we suggest that you try after some time.

column1: What if my plan is not applied?
column2:
- Most recharges are instant, and the operator sends the confirmation message on the recharged number within a few minutes.
- To check if your plan is applied, dial the balance inquiry number for your service provider. 
1. BSNL - *123#
2. VI -Dial *199#
3. Jio тАУ Dial 1299 to get an SMS with details of your active plan
4. Airtel - *121*51#
- If youтАЩve confirmed that the plan details have not been applied, please directly contact your operator and share the Order ID for help with this. You can find the order ID in the history section of your OneCard appтАЩs Store tab.

column1: Why do I see an error message тАШRecharge plan not supportedтАЩ when I try to recharge?
column2: You may see this message if the mobile network operator does not support the plan that you have added. You can proceed with any other plan that is being supported by the operator.

column1: Is the mobile recharge feature the same as featured under other apps like Paytm, PhonePe or other third party Apps?
column2: Yes, the mobile recharge feature is similar to those in other apps like Paytm or Third Party Application Provider Apps.\n

column1: How can I find my Subscriber ID/ Customer ID / Smart Card Number?
column2:
a) Airtel Digital TV
Customer ID is a 10-digit number that starts with the digit '3'.
To know your customer ID, press 'Menu' on your DTH remote and choose тАШMy Account.тАЩ

b) Dish TV
Recharge can be done using the registered mobile number or the viewing card number.
The viewing card number is 11 digits long and starts with the digit '0'.
You can find this at the back of the card inserted in the set-top box.

c) Sun Direct
The smartcard number is printed on the back of the card inserted in the set-top box. Please check the plan that you wish to recharge for and enter that specific amount. Any other amount that differs from the specified plan will result in an unsuccessful transaction.

d) Tata Play
Recharge can be done using the registered mobile number or the subscriber ID.
Subscriber ID is a 10-digit number that starts with the digit '1'. To view the Subscriber ID, press the тАШHomeтАЩ button on the DTH remote.

e) Videocon D2H
To find your subscriber ID, send an SMS 'ID' to 566777 from your registered mobile number.

column1: Can I cancel my DTH order?
column2: No, a DTH recharge once placed cannot be canceled.

column1: How can I recharge my DTH?
column2:
1). You can recharge your DTH on the OneCard mobile app. 
2. Just go to OneStore, then select тАШBill PaymentsтАЩ and then select the тАШDTHтАЩ option and follow the on-screen instructions.
3. Select the operator and then enter the subscriber ID/customer ID/ Smart Card No/Registered Mobile Number.
4. Enter the amount and click тАШPayтАЩ. After payment is successful, you will receive a confirmation.

column1: I am not happy with the operator resolution provided, can I raise a complaint?
column2:
Yes, you can raise a complaint via BBPS (Bharat Bill Pay System), a National Payment Corporation of India (NPCI) initiative that enables interoperable bill payment services to customers. 


Please enter your BBPS reference number, select the issue code, describe the issue, and submit a complaint.

The BBPS reference number can be found on the order details page on тАШYour OrdersтАЩ. You can raise only one complaint for one BBPS reference number.

column1: How long does BBPS issue resolution take?
column2:
Your complaints are resolved by NPCI (National Payment Corporation of India) appointed operating units, and the SLA ranges from 4-7 working days.


Please note that OneCard does not look into these complaints and will not be sending any notification when the complaint gets resolved.

column1: Why do I see a BBPS logo on my DTH recharge page?
column2: You will see the BBPS logo if you try to recharge any of the operators.\nNPCI, as the authorized central unit for BBPS, will also undertake clearing and settlement activities related to transactions routed through BBPS.

column1: Are there any purchase limits for recharges?
column2:
Yes, there are purchase limits in place for recharges.


Operator Min-Max amount Limit (Rs.)


Airtel
Min- 100
Max - 15000


Tata Play
Min- 100
Max - 20000


Dish TV
Min- 100
Max - 25000


Sun Direct
Min- 50
Max - 20000


Videocon / D2H
Min- 100
Max тАУ 20000

These limits might have been updated by the service providers. Contact your service provider for the latest updated limits.

column1: Why is my DTH recharge pending?
column2: DTH recharges are completed instantly. However, if there is a rare case of the payment not going through, it means that there are technical difficulties. Please wait for 24-48 hours, after which your money will be refunded to your source account if the recharge is not successful.

column1: Why is my DTH service not activated even after a successful recharge?
column2: We recommend that you keep your set-top box switched on while recharging. If your service is not activated after a recharge, kindly switch your set-top box off and on. You may also remove and insert the card back. Activation may take up to 20 minutes after the recharge is completed. We request you to wait for 20 minutes and check again.\n\nPlease contact your DTH service provider if it still does not work.

column1: Will I be charged with any kind of extra fees and charges?
column2: As of now, there will not be any extra fees or charges for Mobile Prepaid Recharges\n

column1: Can I modify/delete land lord details?
column2:
While you can't modify or delete existing landlord details, you can add up to three landlords in our system by following these steps: 

1. Open the OneCard app. 
2. Go to the Card Section. 
3. Tap on the "My Rent" tab. 
4. Click on "Pay Now" to add new landlord details.

column1: How do I make rent payment in OneCard app?
column2:
It's easy! Follow these steps to make rent payment in your OneCard app:

1. Go to 'My OneCard' page and click on 'My Rent' option. 
2. Add the rent amount, basic information and your landlord's details.
3. After a successful verification of your landlord's details, click on "Pay Now" to transfer the rent amount.

column1: How many rent payments are allowed in a month?
column2: Take charge with the flexibility to make up to two rent payment transactions per month between the 1st and 30th/31st, ensuring smooth rental experiences.

column1: My rent payment transaction got decline.
column2:
Stay informed! Your rent payment transaction may be declined if: 

1. You attempt to pay more than 30% of your credit limit as rent. 
2. You've already made two rent payments within the current month. 

Keep track for smooth rent transactions with One Credit Card!

column2: Since rent payments fall under the Transfer category, you won't earn rewards for these transactions. \nHowever, enjoy the convenience of seamless rent payments with One Credit Card!

column2: Unlock the flexibility to change your billing date from the profile section after you've paid the Minimum Amount Due (MAD) for the current statement. \n\nYour convenience, our priority!

column1: How do I pay my OneCard bill?
column2:
Ready to pay? Let's make it easy: 

Click 'Pay Now' on the homepage. 
Step 1: Pick your amount/ enter the custom amount, then tap 'Pay Now.'
Step 2: Choose UPI, Debit Card, or Net banking to finish up. 

Note: Remember to check for any transaction limits set by your bank for seamless repayment via UPI.

column1: How do I set-up Auto-Pay?
column2:
Streamline bill payments with Auto-pay! Here's how to set it up: 

Step 1: Click 'Pay Now' on the homepage. 
Step 2: Select 'More Options'.
Step 3: Enable 'Auto-Pay' for automatic bill payments each month.

column1: What are the additional charges levied on OneCard?
column2:
Here are the details for additional charges levied by One Credit Card:

Interest on repayment : 3.75% monthly if payment due.
Forex Markup fee: 1% + GST on international transactions.
Overlimit Charges: 2.5% + GST (Min Rs. 500)
Convenience fee on rent payments: 2% + GST

Note: International transaction amounts may vary due to currency conversion rate changes.

column1: What if I don't pay my outstanding payment on the due date?
column2: It is recommended to at least pay the Minimum Amount Due (MAD) by the due date. If not received, we will report non-payment to the Credit Bureaus after seven days, affecting your Credit Score and future loan/card approvals. Also, Late payment charge and interest fees apply for non-repayment.\n\nTaking care of your payments on time ensures a smooth financial journey!

column1: What is LPC OR Late Payment Charges?
column2:
Late payment charges (LPC) are applied if you don't pay the minimum amount due by the due date. For instance, if your bill is due on the 18th but you pay on the 23rd, late payment charges will apply. 

We understand that unexpected situations can delay payments. To avoid LPC, we recommend you to pay the minimum amount due before the due date. 

Note: Interest accrues on any remaining amount after the due date if you only pay the minimum amount due on or before the due date.

column1: \"LPC рдпрд╛ рд▓реЗрдЯ рдкреЗрдореЗрдВрдЯ рд╢реБрд▓реНрдХ\" рдХреНрдпрд╛ рд╣реИ?
column2:
LPC рдпрд╛ рд▓реЗрдЯ рдкреЗрдореЗрдВрдЯ рдЪрд╛рд░реНрдЬреЗрд╕ рд▓рд╛рдЧреВ рдХрд┐рдпрд╛ рдЬрд╛рддрд╛ рд╣реИ рдЬрдм рдЖрдк рдорд┐рдирд┐рдордо рдЕрдорд╛рдЙрдВрдЯ рдбреНрдпреВ (MAD) рдХреЛ рдбреНрдпреВ рдбреЗрдЯ рд╕реЗ рдкрд╣рд▓реЗ рдпрд╛ рдбреНрдпреВ рдбреЗрдЯ рдХреЗ рджрд┐рди рдирд╣реАрдВ рдкреЗ рдХрд░рддреЗ рд╣реИрдВред

рдЙрджрд╛рд╣рд░рдг рдХреЗ рд▓рд┐рдП, рдпрджрд┐ рдЖрдкрдХреЗ рдмрд┐рд▓ рдХреА рдбреНрдпреВ рдбреЗрдЯ 18 рд╡реАрдВ рд╣реИ, рд▓реЗрдХрд┐рди рдкреЗрдореЗрдВрдЯ 23 рд╡реАрдВ рдХреЛ рдХрд┐рдпрд╛ рдЬрд╛рддрд╛ рд╣реИ, рддреЛ рд▓реЗрдЯ рдкреЗрдореЗрдВрдЯ рдЪрд╛рд░реНрдЬреЗрд╕ рд▓рдЧрд╛рдпрд╛ рдЬрд╛рдПрдЧрд╛ред

рд╣рдо рд╕рдордЭрддреЗ рд╣реИрдВ рдХрд┐ рдХрдард┐рди рдкрд░рд┐рд╕реНрдерд┐рддрд┐рдпрд╛рдБ рдХрднреА-рдХрднреА рд╕рдордп рдкрд░ рдкреЗрдореЗрдВрдЯ рдХрд░рдиреЗ рд╕реЗ рд░реЛрдХ рд╕рдХрддреА рд╣реИред рд▓реЗрдЯ рдкреЗрдореЗрдВрдЯ рдЪрд╛рд░реНрдЬреЗрд╕ рд╕реЗ рдмрдЪрдиреЗ рдХреЗ рд▓рд┐рдП, рд╣рдо рдЖрдкрдХреЛ рд╕рд▓рд╛рд╣ рджреЗрддреЗ рд╣реИрдВ рдХрд┐ рдорд┐рдирд┐рдордо рдЕрдорд╛рдЙрдВрдЯ рдбреНрдпреВ рдХреЛ рдбреНрдпреВ рдбреЗрдЯ рд╕реЗ рдкрд╣рд▓реЗ рдкреЗ рдХрд░реЗрдВред

column1: How do I pay my OneCard bill?
column2:
Ready to pay? Let's make it easy: 

Click 'Pay Now' on the homepage. 
Step 1: Pick your amount/ enter the custom amount, then tap 'Pay Now.'
Step 2: Choose UPI, Debit Card, or Net banking to finish up. 

Note: Remember to check for any transaction limits set by your bank for seamless repayment via UPI.

column1: How do I set-up Auto-Pay?
column2:
Streamline bill payments with Auto-pay! Here's how to set it up: 

Step 1: Click 'Pay Now' on the homepage. 
Step 2: Select 'More Options'.
Step 3: Enable 'Auto-Pay' for automatic bill payments each month.

column1: I paid my OneCard bill on time via another app, but I was still charged a late payment fee.
column2: Please note that payments done using third-party apps like CRED, PhonePe, PayTM, and others may take 3-5 working days to get settled. It is advised that you take this into consideration while paying your bills.\n\nFor smooth transactions, pay bills directly through the OneCard app for instant credit!

column1: Is there a fuel surcharge on OneCard?
column2: Fuel transactions made with One Credit Card enjoy a waived fuel surcharge, up to Rs. 400 per month per account. Once you've enjoyed this perk, a small surcharge of 1% of the transaction amount + GST is applied. \n\nHappy driving and saving!

column1: I want to know more about interest charges
column2:
Rest assured! as long as you pay the total due amount before or on the due date, you won't incur any interest charges.
However, if there happens to be an unpaid remaining amount due after the bill due date, a modest 3.75% monthly interest will apply.

To know more you can click on the below option

column1: What are the additional charges levied on OneCard?
column2:
Here are the details for additional charges levied by One Credit Card:

Interest on repayment : 3.75% monthly if payment due.
Forex Markup fee: 1% + GST on international transactions.
Overlimit Charges: 2.5% + GST (Min Rs. 500)
Convenience fee on rent payments: 2% + GST

Note: International transaction amounts may vary due to currency conversion rate changes.

column1: What if I don't pay my outstanding payment on the due date?
column2: It is recommended to at least pay the Minimum Amount Due (MAD) by the due date. If not received, we will report non-payment to the Credit Bureaus after seven days, affecting your Credit Score and future loan/card approvals. Also, Late payment charge and interest fees apply for non-repayment.\n\nTaking care of your payments on time ensures a smooth financial journey!

column1: What is LPC OR Late Payment Charges?
column2:
Late payment charges (LPC) are applied if you don't pay the minimum amount due by the due date. For instance, if your bill is due on the 18th but you pay on the 23rd, late payment charges will apply. 

We understand that unexpected situations can delay payments. To avoid LPC, we recommend you to pay the minimum amount due before the due date. 

Note: Interest accrues on any remaining amount after the due date if you only pay the minimum amount due on or before the due date.

column1: \"LPC рдпрд╛ рд▓реЗрдЯ рдкреЗрдореЗрдВрдЯ рд╢реБрд▓реНрдХ\" рдХреНрдпрд╛ рд╣реИ?
column2:
LPC рдпрд╛ рд▓реЗрдЯ рдкреЗрдореЗрдВрдЯ рдЪрд╛рд░реНрдЬреЗрд╕ рд▓рд╛рдЧреВ рдХрд┐рдпрд╛ рдЬрд╛рддрд╛ рд╣реИ рдЬрдм рдЖрдк рдорд┐рдирд┐рдордо рдЕрдорд╛рдЙрдВрдЯ рдбреНрдпреВ (MAD) рдХреЛ рдбреНрдпреВ рдбреЗрдЯ рд╕реЗ рдкрд╣рд▓реЗ рдпрд╛ рдбреНрдпреВ рдбреЗрдЯ рдХреЗ рджрд┐рди рдирд╣реАрдВ рдкреЗ рдХрд░рддреЗ рд╣реИрдВред

рдЙрджрд╛рд╣рд░рдг рдХреЗ рд▓рд┐рдП, рдпрджрд┐ рдЖрдкрдХреЗ рдмрд┐рд▓ рдХреА рдбреНрдпреВ рдбреЗрдЯ 18 рд╡реАрдВ рд╣реИ, рд▓реЗрдХрд┐рди рдкреЗрдореЗрдВрдЯ 23 рд╡реАрдВ рдХреЛ рдХрд┐рдпрд╛ рдЬрд╛рддрд╛ рд╣реИ, рддреЛ рд▓реЗрдЯ рдкреЗрдореЗрдВрдЯ рдЪрд╛рд░реНрдЬреЗрд╕ рд▓рдЧрд╛рдпрд╛ рдЬрд╛рдПрдЧрд╛ред

рд╣рдо рд╕рдордЭрддреЗ рд╣реИрдВ рдХрд┐ рдХрдард┐рди рдкрд░рд┐рд╕реНрдерд┐рддрд┐рдпрд╛рдБ рдХрднреА-рдХрднреА рд╕рдордп рдкрд░ рдкреЗрдореЗрдВрдЯ рдХрд░рдиреЗ рд╕реЗ рд░реЛрдХ рд╕рдХрддреА рд╣реИред рд▓реЗрдЯ рдкреЗрдореЗрдВрдЯ рдЪрд╛рд░реНрдЬреЗрд╕ рд╕реЗ рдмрдЪрдиреЗ рдХреЗ рд▓рд┐рдП, рд╣рдо рдЖрдкрдХреЛ рд╕рд▓рд╛рд╣ рджреЗрддреЗ рд╣реИрдВ рдХрд┐ рдорд┐рдирд┐рдордо рдЕрдорд╛рдЙрдВрдЯ рдбреНрдпреВ рдХреЛ рдбреНрдпреВ рдбреЗрдЯ рд╕реЗ рдкрд╣рд▓реЗ рдкреЗ рдХрд░реЗрдВред

column1: Why are all my installments not equal?
column2: One Credit Card EMI operates on a reducing balance method, which means that each month, you repay a portion of the principal amount along with the interest on the remaining outstanding balance. As a result, the EMI amount decreases over time.\n\nAdditionally, the GST is applicable to the fees and charges associated with the EMI. The GST rate is subject to government regulations and can impact the overall cost of the EMI.

column1: Why is the OneCash installment amount different from the one shown during the transaction?
column2: The OneCash installment posted to your account consists of the principal amount, interest, and taxes levied on the interest. \n\nAdditionally, the first installment also includes the processing fees charged.

column1: Can I avoid a DCC transaction?
column2: When transacting abroad, if given the option to pay in your home currency (INR), select the local currency (destination country currency) to avoid Dynamic Currency Conversion (DCC) charges. \n- In online transactions, you may not always have the option, but the OneCard app will show the merchant location for reference. ЁЯТ│ЁЯМР

column1: How can I access the 'OneTrips' feature in OneCard app?
column2:
It's easy! Here are the steps:

1. Navigate to the 'My Card' screen from the second tab at the bottom of the OneCard Home screen. 
2. Scroll down and click on OneTrips. 
3. Tap the button below to check out the OneTrips feature now. 

Note: Please ensure your app is updated to the latest version. ЁЯУ▒ЁЯТ╝

column1: How is the amount per person calculated and what does that include?
column2: Your trip budget on One Credit Card is personalized, considering your preferences. It covers flight, experience, local transport, shopping, food, dining, and accommodation based on your spending behavior and chosen 'trip style'. \n\nPlan your perfect getaway with One Credit Card! column1: Is my OneCard enabled for international transactions?
column2:
Your One Credit Card is an international credit card accepted by over 44 million merchants in 200+ countries. 

- International transactions are by default disabled for your One Credit Card due to security reasons . 
- It's recommended to enable your International Card Controls before making planned international trips or online transactions with international merchants.

To change your International Card Controls settings:

Navigate to the 'My Card' screen from the second tab at the bottom of the home screen > Scroll down to 'My Controls' > Click on 'View All Controls' > Navigate to the 'International' tab to activate/deactivate different types of transactions.

On this same screen, you can also set transaction limits for each type of transaction from the 'Advanced Controls' section.

column1: рдХреНрдпрд╛ рдореЗрд░реЗ рд╡рдирдХрд╛рд░реНрдб рдкрд░ рдЕрдВрддрд░рд░рд╛рд╖реНрдЯреНрд░реАрдп рдЯреНрд░рд╛рдВрдЬрд╝реЗрдХрд╢рдиреНрд╕ рдЗрдиреЗрдмрд▓реНрдб рд╣реИрдВ?
column2:
рдЖрдкрдХрд╛ OneCard рдПрдХ рдЕрдВрддрд░рд░рд╛рд╖реНрдЯреНрд░реАрдп рдХреНрд░реЗрдбрд┐рдЯ рдХрд╛рд░реНрдб рд╣реИ рдЬрд┐рд╕реЗ 200+ рджреЗрд╢реЛрдВ рдореЗрдВ рекрек рдорд┐рд▓рд┐рдпрди рд╕реЗ реЫреНрдпрд╛рджрд╛ рдорд░реНрдЪреЗрдВрдЯреНрд╕ рдиреЗ рд╕реНрд╡реАрдХрд╛рд░ рдХрд┐рдпрд╛ рд╣реИред рд╕реБрд░рдХреНрд╖рд╛ рдХреЗ рд▓рд┐рдП, рдЕрдВрддрд░рд░рд╛рд╖реНрдЯреНрд░реАрдп transaction рдбрд┐рдлрд╝реЙрд▓реНрдЯ рд░реВрдк рд╕реЗ рдмрдВрдж рд╣реЛрддреЗ рд╣реИрдВред 

Trips рдпрд╛ рдСрдирд▓рд╛рдЗрди transaction рдХрд░рдиреЗ рд╕реЗ рдкрд╣рд▓реЗ International Card Control рдХреЛ рдПрдХреНрдЯрд┐рд╡рдЯреЗ рдХрд░ рд▓реЗ, рдирд┐рдЪреЗ рд╕реЗрдЯрд┐рдВрдЧреНрд╕ рдмрджрд▓рдиреЗ рдХреЗ рд▓рд┐рдП рд╕реНрдЯреЗрдкреНрд╕ рджрд┐рдП рдЧрдП рд╣реИ:

рд╣реЛрдо рд╕реНрдХреНрд░реАрди рдХреЗ рдиреАрдЪреЗ рджреВрд╕рд░реЗ рдЯреИрдм рд╕реЗ 'My Card' рд╕реНрдХреНрд░реАрди рдкрд░ рдиреЗрд╡рд┐рдЧреЗрдЯ рдХрд░реЗрдВ > рдиреАрдЪреЗ 'My Controls' рддрдХ рд╕реНрдХреНрд░реЙрд▓ рдХрд░реЗрдВ > 'View All Controls' рдкрд░ рдХреНрд▓рд┐рдХ рдХрд░реЗрдВ > рдкреНрд░рддреНрдпреЗрдХ рдкреНрд░рдХрд╛рд░ рдХреЗ рдЯреНрд░рд╛рдВрдЬрд╝реЗрдХрд╢рдиреНрд╕ рдХреЛ рдПрдХреНрдЯрд┐рд╡реЗрдЯ/рдбреАрдПрдХреНрдЯрд┐рд╡реЗрдЯ рдХрд░рдиреЗ рдХреЗ рд▓рд┐рдП 'International' рдЯреИрдм рдкрд░ рдиреЗрд╡рд┐рдЧреЗрдЯ рдХрд░реЗрдВред

рдЖрдк рдЗрд╕реА рд╕реНрдХреНрд░реАрди рдкрд░ 'Advance Controls' рд╕реЗрдХреНрд╢рди рд╕реЗ рдкреНрд░рддреНрдпреЗрдХ рдкреНрд░рдХрд╛рд░ рдХреЗ transaction рдХреЗ рд▓рд┐рдП transaction рдХреА рд▓рд┐рдорд┐рдЯ рднреА рд╕реЗрдЯ рдХрд░ рд╕рдХрддреЗ рд╣реИ l

column1: What are the charges applicable on international transactions using OneCard?
column2:
For every international transaction, conversion rates apply as per Visa Exchange Rates at the time of settlement, with a 1% forex fee + 18% GST. 

For example, if a USD 100 transaction is settled at a conversion rate of USD 1 = INR 80.00, the total amount in INR would be: 
(100 x 80) x (1 + 1%(1 + 18%)) = (100 x 80) x (1.0118) = INR 8,094.40. ЁЯТ│ЁЯМР

column1: рд╡рдирдХрд╛рд░реНрдб рдХреЗ реЫрд░рд┐рдП рдХрд┐рдП рдЧрдП рдЕрдВрддрд░реНрд░рд╛рд╖реНрдЯреНрд░реАрдп рдЯреНрд░рд╛рдВрдЬрд╝реЗрдХрд╢рди рдкрд░ рдХреНрдпрд╛ рдЪрд╛рд░реНрдЬреЗрд╕ рд▓рд╛рдЧреВ рд╣реЛрддреЗ рд╣реИрдВ?

column1: What happens in case of a DCC transaction?
column2:
In a Dynamic Currency Conversion (DCC) transaction, you will be charged Forex fees twice - once by the merchant and once by the card issuer (in this case, One Credit Card).

- This could lead to higher charges compared to regular international transactions. 
 
- It's recommended to choose the local currency option whenever available during transactions to avoid additional charges. ЁЯТ│ЁЯМР

column1: DCC transactions рдореЗрдВ рдХреНрдпрд╛ рд╣реЛрддрд╛ рд╣реИ?
column2: рдбрд╛рдпрдиреЗрдорд┐рдХ рдХрд░рдВрд╕реА рдХрдиреНрд╡рд░реНрдЬрди (DCC) transaction рдореЗрдВ, рдЖрдкрд╕реЗ рдлреЛрд░реЗрдХреНрд╕ реЮреАрд╕ рджреЛ рдмрд╛рд░ рд▓рд┐рдпрд╛ рдЬрд╛рдпреЗрдЧрд╛ - рдПрдХ рдмрд╛рд░ рд╡реНрдпрд╛рдкрд╛рд░реА рдХреА рдУрд░ рд╕реЗ рдФрд░ рдПрдХ рдмрд╛рд░ рдХрд╛рд░реНрдб рдЗрд╢реВрдЕрд░ рдХреА рдУрд░ рд╕реЗ (рдЗрд╕ рдорд╛рдорд▓реЗ рдореЗрдВ, OneCard)ред\n\nрдЗрд╕рд╕реЗ рдЖрдкрдХреЗ рдЗрдВрдЯрд░рдиреЗрд╢рдирд▓ рдЯреНрд░рд╛рдВрд╕рдХреНрд╢рди рдкрд░ реЫреНрдпрд╛рджрд╛ рдЪрд╛рд░реНрдЬреЗрд╕ рд▓рдЧ рд╕рдХрддреЗ рд╣реИред рдЗрд╕рд▓рд┐рдП рд╣рдо рд╕рд▓рд╛рд╣ рджреЗрдВрдЧреЗ рдХреА рд╡рд╣рд╛ рдХреЗ рд▓реЛрдХрд▓ рдХрд░реЗрдВрд╕реА рдореЗрдВ рд╣реА transaction рдХрд░реЗред

column1: What happens in case of refund or reversal of an international transaction using OneCard?
column2: - When an international transaction is reversed, the entire transaction amount, calculated with the conversion rate on the reversal date, including forex fees and taxes, is credited back to your account. \n\n- For a refund transaction, only the amount corresponding to the conversion rates on the refund date is credited, excluding forex fees and taxes. ЁЯТ│

column1: рд╡рдирдХрд╛рд░реНрдб рдХреЗ реЫрд░рд┐рдП рдХрд┐рдП рдЧрдП рдЕрдВрддрд░реНрд░рд╛рд╖реНрдЯреНрд░реАрдп рдЯреНрд░рд╛рдВрдЬрд╝реЗрдХрд╢рди рдХреЗ рд░рд┐рдлрдВрдб рдпрд╛ рд░рд┐рд╡рд░реНрд╕рд▓ рдХреЗ рдорд╛рдорд▓реЗ рдореЗрдВ рдХреНрдпрд╛ рд╣реЛрддрд╛ рд╣реИ?

column1: What happens when some International merchants like hotels temporarily hold an amount for pre-booking?
column2:
In cases where the authorized amount is on hold and the transaction is not settled:

a) If the settlement amount exceeds the authorized amount, the authorized amount is reversed within 3 working days and the higher settlement amount is debited from One Credit Card.

b) If the settlement amount is lower than the authorised amount, then the updated settlement amount is debited, with a partial reversal of the excess.

c) If no settlement occurs for over 7 days, the entire amount will be reversed. ЁЯТ│ЁЯФД

Stay informed and rest assured, we're here to keep your transactions seamless!

b) рдпрджрд┐ рд╕реЗрдЯрд▓рдореЗрдВрдЯ рдЕрдорд╛рдЙрдВрдЯ рдСрдерд░рд╛рдЗреЫреНрдб рдЕрдорд╛рдЙрдВрдЯ рд╕реЗ рдХрдо рд╣реИ, рддреЛ рдЕрдкрдбреЗрдЯреЗрдб рд╕реЗрдЯрд▓рдореЗрдВрдЯ рдЕрдорд╛рдЙрдВрдЯ рдХреЛ рдбреЗрдмрд┐рдЯ рдХрд┐рдпрд╛ рдЬрд╛рддрд╛ рд╣реИ, рдФрд░ реЫреНрдпрд╛рджрд╛ рдЕрдорд╛рдЙрдВрдЯ рдХреЛ рдкрд╛рд░реНрд╢рд▓реА рд░рд┐рд╡рд░реНрд╕ рдХрд┐рдпрд╛ рдЬрд╛рддрд╛ рд╣реИред

column1: What is a DCC transaction?
column2: Dynamic Currency Conversion (DCC) enables offline transactions in your home currency (INR) while abroad, but merchants may apply extra service charges. It's recommended to choose the local currency option whenever possible.

column1: Where can I see the breakup of the forex charges of my international transactions?
column2:
In your transaction statements or recent transactions, the label "Forex" is added next to the transaction category to indicate all international transactions. 

To view the details:
Step 1. Click on the specific transaction labeled "Forex." 
Step 2. Select 'See Details' to access a breakdown that includes:

┬╖ Merchant details 
┬╖ Transaction ID.
┬╖ Original transaction amount.
┬╖ Transaction currency.
┬╖ Conversion rate.
┬╖ Fees & taxes applicable to the transaction.

Enjoy managing your transactions globally with ease! ЁЯТ│ЁЯМР

column1: Which users is the OneTrips feature live for?
column2: The OneTrips feature is live for VISA OneCard users for now.

column1: Why is the amount showing differently (It was Rs.X when the transaction was made now it is showing as Rs.Y)?
column2: Foreign currency conversion rates change daily. The amount shown during the transaction is calculated based on the rates applicable on the transaction day. \n\nThe final amount added to your bill may differ, as it is calculated based on the rates applicable on the day when the transaction was settled. column1: What if I have not received my 5X bonus reward?
column2:
Unlock the 5X bonus reward by making transactions in at least 3 eligible categories! 

The following points are considered for 5X bonus rewards:

- Your rewards are credited on the 10th of each month. 

- Refunds for a specific category will be considered into the final list for 5X bonus rewards. 
Also, If a refund occurs for a transaction from the previous month, it will affect the 5X bonus rewards in the following month's calculation.

Note: Rewards are not applicable for transfers, jewellery, and rent payments.

column1: How many reward points will I get on my floater RuPay card & UPI purchase?
column2: You will not get any rewards points on purchases done with your floater RuPay Credit Card or UPI spends done with this card.

column1: What is OnePass?
column2: OnePass is a feature available in the Rewards Section of the OneCard app. It offers passes that users can activate to earn rewards such as points or vouchers by completing specific actions. Each pass comes with unique terms and conditions.

column1: How can I activate OnePass?
column2: To activate a OnePass, go to the Rewards Section in the app and browse through the available passes. Select the OnePass you wish to activate and follow the prompts to confirm the activation. Activation of OnePass comes at a cost, which will be specified before activation.

column1: What happens after I activate a OnePass?
column2: After activating a OnePass, you need to complete the actions associated with the pass to earn rewards. The rewards, such as points or vouchers, will be credited to your account in real-time or deferred after completing the required actions subject to terms of the pass.

column1: Where can I track my rewards from OnePass?
column2: You can track all your earnings from OnePass by going to the тАЬMy PurchaseтАЭ section in the OnePass dashboard. This section shows all the rewards youтАЩve earned for the actions completed under your activated passes.

column1: Are rewards credited instantly?
column2: Yes, rewards for actions completed under OnePass are credited to your account in real-time. However, if any associated transaction is refunded, reversed, or canceled, the rewards will be deducted accordingly. Again, time of crediting rewards is subject to change from one pass to the other.

column1: Can I refund or reverse an activated OnePass?
column2: No, once a OnePass is activated, it cannot be refunded or reversed. However, if any transaction linked to your pass is canceled or reversed, the associated rewards will be adjusted.

column1: What are the terms and conditions for each OnePass?
column2: Each OnePass comes with its own set of terms and conditions, which will be presented to you at the time of activation. Make sure to read and understand them before activating the pass.

column1: What is the cost of activating a OnePass?
column2: The activation cost varies depending on the specific OnePass. The cost will be clearly shown before you proceed with activation.

column1: How do I know if my actions qualify for rewards under OnePass?
column2: Each OnePass is linked to specific actions that qualify for rewards. You can view the list of eligible actions within the OnePass details before activation. Only these actions will earn you rewards.

column1: When are the 5X reward points credited?
column2: Unlock 5X reward points in your top 2 categories, credited on the 10th of each month! \n\nEnjoy the perks! ЁЯМЯЁЯТ│ЁЯУЕ

column1: How does refund / reversal affect my OneCard bill ?
column2:
a. If your original transaction date and the date of refund fall in the same billing cycle, your refund will be adjusted with the bill of that cycle.

b. If the refund is credited after the bill has been generated for the cycle in which the transaction was made, the refund will be adjusted against the billed amount of that cycle. 

c. However, if you have already paid the bill for the cycle in which the transaction was originally made, the refund amount will be adjusted against the bill of the next cycle.

column1: I have received a refund. Can I get it transferred to my bank account?
column2: Refunds and reversals are usually adjusted against your outstanding balance. But if youтАЩve received a refund or reversal for a purchase from your previous billing cycle, you can choose to transfer the amount into your bank account from the тАШRecent TransactionsтАЩ section in the app. Once you claim this refund/reversal, it may lead to an increase in your outstanding balance.\n\nNote: To claim this refund/reversal, the refund or reversal amount should be Rs. 100 or more. Additionally, you must claim this refund within 7 days of it being credited to your One Credit Card account.

column1: Money got debited from OneCard but not credited to merchant

column1: Swipe to Pay is not working.
column2:
Here are some helpful tips:

1. Activate Swipe-to-Pay controls.
2. Allow OneCard App to send notifications (for Android & iOS users).
3. Enable display pop-up over other apps (for Android users).
4. Update your app to the latest version and try again.

If you still don't see the Swipe-to-Pay pop-up, open your App to authenticate your transaction.
Alternatively, you can click on the 'Approve by OTP' link to complete the transaction via OTP verification.

column1: What are the best practices for budgeting?
column2:
Here's a simple guide to budgeting your monthly expenses: 

1. Allocate 50% for essentials like bills, groceries, and rent.
2. Set aside 30% for entertainment, shopping, and gifts.
3. Reserve 20% for emergencies and savings.

If a month gets tight on your budget, don't worry! You can always opt for OneCard EMI to help you manage unexpected expenses without stress!

column2: We'll send you alerts at 80% and 100% of your set budget to help you stay informed about your spending. ЁЯУКЁЯЪи

column1: Why are my transactions getting declined?
column2: Transactions may occasionally be declined to safeguard your account, especially with risky merchants or high-value transfers. To maintain a healthy spending pattern, you can try transacting in smaller amounts or with different merchants.\n\nAlso, Check your 'My Controls' section in the app to verify if Online, POS, or Contactless Payments are enabled.

column1: Will I be charged on reaching my budget?
column2: Don't worry about hitting your budget! It's there for your reference, and you won't be charged if you reach your budget. ЁЯУКЁЯТ│ЁЯЪл

column2: You'll receive an alert only when you reach 100% of your budget. Remember, the budget is for your reference, and your transactions won't be declined because of it. \n\nStay on top and in charge!ЁЯУЙЁЯЪлЁЯФФ

column1: Can I cancel my pending payment?
column2:
You canтАЩt cancel UPI payments once initiated as they are direct bank-to-bank transfers. 

We request that you wait for 48 hours from the time you made the payment to know if your payment is successful or has failed.

Note: If your pending payment fails, your entire amount will be refunded to your account within 5 working days.

column1: Can I change my UPI ID?
column2: You can change your UPI ID from Manage UPI in profile section.

column1: Can I use RuPay One Credit Card for making UPI transactions?
column2: Currently, RuPay One Credit Card is available for limited users.\nIf you are eligible, you will get an option to link your card on UPI on OneCard dashboard.

column1: I am unable to add my bank account on OneCard.
column2:
There may be several reasons why you are unable to add your bank account on OneCard. 

Here are a few things that you can check:
- Your mobile number on OneCard and the number youтАЩve registered with your bank account is the same.
- YouтАЩve activated mobile banking services for the bank account youтАЩre trying to add.
- You're the primary bank account holder

The bank account youтАЩre trying to add is any one of the following types:
- Savings account
- Current account
- Joint/HUF account (only where you are the primary account holder)
- Overdraft account

column1: I don't receive the refund after 5 days for a failed UPI payment.
column2: In the rare case that your bank doesnтАЩt refund your money after 5 days for a failed UPI payment, please contact your bank with the 12-digit Unique Transaction Reference (UTR) number. As refunds are processed by banks, they are better placed to help you with this.

column1: I'm unable to receive money in my RuPay Credit Card using UPI.
column2: You will not be able to receive money in your RuPay Credit Card using UPI.\n\nSimilarly, you can only use your Rupay credit card for payments to merchants or bills & recharges. You cannot use it to send money to family members or friends.

column1: Payment is deducted, but not reflected in the merchantтАЩs account.
column2:
Your transaction is successful, but due to some issue at the receiverтАЩs bank end, there is a delay. 
The amount will reach him/her in 48 hours, once the bank is done with its daily settlements. Please ask the receiver to check their bank statement in 48 hours.

If your UPI payment fails for any reason, there is no need to worry as your money is absolutely safe with your bank. Your bank will automatically refund the money to your account within 5 days from the date you made the payment. You can check your relevant bank account statement after 5 days for a confirmation.

column1: What are the transaction limits applicable on OneCard UPI?
column2:
UPI Rules on OneCard as same as any other TPAP (as directed by NPCI)

1 Lakh Amount entry limit for P2P txns on UI
1 Lakh Amount entry limit for P2M txns on UI except certain MCCs
5 Lakh Amount limit for IPO to be supported
5 Lakh Amount entry limit on UI for Gsec RBI Direct 6211 txns
2 Lakh Amount limit on UI for Capital Market 6211 txns
2 Lakh Amount limit on UI for Collections (MCC 7322) txns
2 Lakh Amount limit on UI for Insurance (MCC 5960, 6300, 6529) txns
Only 5 collect request initiations per day
5000Rs amount entry limit on UI for all UPI txns (except verified P2M txns) for first 24hrs of onboarding
Collect response for MCC 5816 to be limited at 2000Rs/day for iOS
2000Rs limit for P2P/P2PM/P2M Non-verified collect response
2000Rs limit for P2P/P2PM/P2M nonverified share intent
2000Rs limit for non-verified P2P/P2PM/P2M QR scan payments
Cooling period not applicable for verified merchants
Wallet recharge limit - 5000Rs

column1: What are the transaction limits immediately after resetting my UPI PIN?
column2:
Immediately after you set a new PIN or reset an old UPI PIN, your bank sets a cooling-off period on your account to ensure security. The duration of this period will vary from bank to bank.

During this cooling-off period, your bank will apply a limit on the following:
- The amount you can send per UPI payment and the total amount you can send in a day.
- The number of UPI payments you can make in an hour or in a day.

After the cooling-off period,
- The amount you can send per UPI payment and in one day will return to тВ╣1,00,000 (a few banks may have lesser limits)
- The number of UPI payments you can make in one day will return to 10

Important: The limits during this period and the cooling-off period itself vary from bank to bank.

column1: What is RuPay Credit Card on UPI?
column2: You can use your RuPay Credit Card to make UPI payments on OneCard. All you need to do is activate your RuPay Credit Card and UPI and set a UPI PIN to make secure payments.

column1: What is UPI Lite?
column2: UPI Lite is a feature that allows you to enjoy the convenience of making instant UPI payments for upto тВ╣500 without entering your UPI PIN. All you need to do is add money to UPI Lite in the OneCard App to start making these payments.

column1: Why is my UPI payment still pending?
column2: Banks usually complete UPI payments instantly. In rare cases, due to technical issues, banks may take additional time to deposit the payment amount into the receiverтАЩs account. \n\nIn such cases, itтАЩs recommended that you wait for 48 hours from the time of payment to know the final status.
